name: PathToWindowOrDoor
description:
# PathToWindowOrDoor v1 ___ Welcome to PathToWindowOrDoor. This script helps quickly convert 2 point line paths to the new windows or doors ### Using PathToWindowOrDoor This script will convert all single-segment paths on dynamic lighting & map layer (on a page or across the entire game)that match a specific color into either windows or doors, depending on the chosen command.
For example: If the setting for hidden doors is the color green (#00ff00),then all single-segment green paths will be converted to a hidden door.

**You can configure the color relationship in the Bio tab of a character created by the script.**

#### BEWAREThis script won't ask for confirmation, it will convert all single-segment paths on DL & map layer which color correspond to configuration, if you want to limit scope, be sure to read next section.

**Default configuration :** - Hidden Doors: #00ff00 - Locked Doors: #ff9900 - Unlocked Doors: #ffff00 - Windows: #00ffff ### Basic Command Syntax The script uses a standardized API command syntax. All PathToWindowOrDoor commands will begin with **!ptwod**. This will then be followedby a space a double dash preceding a keyword and options group. This looks like this: **!ptwod --keyWord|option1|option2|...** For example: By default you will convert on the current page all single-segment green, yellow and orange paths to the new doorsby using the command !ptwod --convertDoors|page
If the "|page" flag is omitted, then the script will convert all matching paths across the entire game
### Converting Windows

Convert windows using the !ptwod --convertWindows or !ptwod --convertWindows|page commands #### Configured Windows segments converted as : - Windows color => Roll20 Windows Locked by default

### Converting Doors

Convert doors using the !ptwod --convertDoors or !ptwod --convertDoors|page commands #### Configured Doors segments converted as : - Hidden color => Roll20 Secret doors Locked by default - Locked color => Roll20 Locked doors - Unlocked color => Normal Roll20 doors **All doors are closed by default**

### Special Thanks Thanks to Scott C.h, this script is started from his DoorKnocker work which i stripped and adapted to fit my needs and learn a things or two.
